title: Week 10 Final Exam: Digital Credit & Experience
description: Assessment on modern lending products like BNPL, credit scoring, and the grammar of life experiences using Present Perfect.

questions.question: What does BNPL allow a consumer to do?
options: Pay for everything in cash immediately
Buy an item now and pay for it in future installments
Borrow money from a friend via an app
Invest in the stock market with high risk
questions.explanation: BNPL (Buy Now, Pay Later) permite comprar algo ahora y pagarlo después en cuotas.

questions.question: Which term describes the numerical representation of your creditworthiness?
questions.explanation: El 'Credit Score' es la puntuación numérica que indica qué tan fiable eres para recibir un crédito.

questions.question: Complete the experience: 'I __________ never used a BNPL service for my shopping.'
questions.explanation: Con el sujeto 'I', usamos 'have' para formar el presente perfecto de experiencias.

questions.question: What is 'Instant Approval' in the context of digital loans?
options: Waiting 3 weeks for a bank letter
A fast decision made by an algorithm within seconds
Paying a fee to get a faster response
questions.explanation: La aprobación instantánea ocurre cuando un algoritmo decide si te dan el préstamo en segundos.

questions.question: What is the past participle of the verb 'take'?
questions.explanation: El participio pasado de 'take' es 'taken'.

questions.question: Which of these is the annual cost of borrowing money, expressed as a percentage?
questions.explanation: El APR (tipo de interés anual) es el coste total de pedir dinero prestado.

questions.question: Complete the question: '__________ you ever applied for a credit limit increase?'
questions.explanation: Para preguntas sobre experiencias en presente perfecto con 'you', usamos 'Have'.

questions.question: If you 'default' on a loan, what have you done?
options: Failed to make the required payments
questions.explanation: Estar en 'default' significa que no has cumplido con los pagos acordados.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'Sarah __________ already paid four installments of her car loan.'
questions.explanation: Para la tercera persona singular (Sarah), usamos el auxiliar 'has'.

questions.question: What is the 'Grace Period' on a credit card?
options: The time when you can spend more than your limit
The time when you don't pay interest on new purchases
The time it takes for a physical card to arrive
The time you spend talking to a bank teller
questions.explanation: El periodo de gracia es el tiempo en el que no pagas intereses si liquidas tu deuda a tiempo.

questions.question: Which verb is used in the Present Perfect for submitting a loan request?
questions.explanation: El participio pasado de 'apply' es 'applied'.

questions.question: The total amount currently owed on a credit account is the...
questions.explanation: El 'balance' es el saldo o cantidad total que le debes al banco actualmente.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence for a financial experience:
options: I have pay the debt yesterday.
I have paid the debt three times.
I paid the debt since last year.
I am paying the debt already.
questions.explanation: La estructura correcta de presente perfecto es 'have' + participio pasado ('paid').

questions.question: What does a 'Micro-loan' usually refer to?
options: A loan for millions of dollars
A very large mortgage for a mansion
A small, short-term loan often accessed via an app
A loan that never has to be paid back
questions.explanation: Un micro-préstamo es un préstamo pequeño y de corta duración, común en apps de fintech.

questions.question: Complete the negative experience: 'We __________ not received the funds in our account yet.'
questions.explanation: Con 'We', el auxiliar correcto es 'have' para el presente perfecto.

questions.question: What is the past participle of 'pay'?
questions.explanation: El participio pasado de 'pay' es irregular: 'paid'.

questions.question: Why is a high credit score important?
options: It means you have a lot of friends
It allows you to get lower interest rates and better loan terms
It makes your phone work faster
It hides your balance from the bank
questions.explanation: Un score alto te da acceso a mejores condiciones y menores tipos de interés.

questions.question: In the Present Perfect, which word do we often use in questions about experiences?
questions.explanation: 'Ever' se usa en preguntas para preguntar si alguien ha hecho algo 'alguna vez'.

questions.question: What is a 'Credit Limit'?
options: The minimum you must pay each month
The maximum amount you are allowed to borrow on one account
The cost of the plastic card
questions.explanation: El límite de crédito es la cantidad máxima que el banco te permite gastar o pedir prestada.

questions.question: Complete: 'Has he __________ his credit report this month?'
questions.explanation: Después de 'has', necesitamos el participio pasado 'checked'.
